p.s: The given excerpt focuses on Gatsby's difficulties of recapturing his past with Daisy, which shows his vulnerable and emotional side of his character.
At the beginning of the excerpt the narrator explains that Gatsby was looking pale as death with his hands deep inside his coat pockets.

This indicates that Gatsby is nervous about his encounter with Daisy and his hands in his pockets underline that he wants to hide himself just like his hands due to the embarassmentembarrassment he is feeling (p. 84, l. 14-15).
The sharply turn Gatsby takes into the living room shows his overwhelment (p. 84, l. 18).
Furthermore the fact that Gatsby is keeping his hands inside his pockets throughout the whole situation, symbolizes his embarassmentembarrassment even more.

As Gatsby then encounters Daisy he mutters We've met before even though his eyes were glancing and his lips attempted to laugh, which gives a contradiction between the previous embarassmentembarrassment and his happiness of seeing Daisy (p. 85, l. 3).

In addition his waiting pose he is sitting in on the chair, shows the shallowness he is now feeling, because Gatsby is unsure about what he will say, which gets underlined by the fact that he gives a plump excuse about the clock, he nearly destroyed before by slamming it with his hands as he couldn't sit still because of his insecurity (p. 85, l. 9).
Furthermore Gatsby answers DaisysDaisy's statement that they haven't seen each other for years, instantly with the exact time they haven't seen.
This memorization of Gatsby indicates that Gatsby has been waiting for their day of reunion undoubtly and it shows that Gatsby has thought about her a lot.
After that Nick and Daisy primaly have a conversation without Gatsby included, which underlines their insecurities of talking to each other (p. 85, l. 23-24).
Furthermore Nick wants to leave the situation to get Gatsby and Daisy closer, but Gatsby escapes the situation as well by telling Nick he needs to talk with him (p. 85, l. 29).
This try of escaping the situation indicates Gatsby's overwhelment once more and as Gatsby tells Nick that this meeting would be a mistake his pure insecurity gets to the focus (p. 86, l. 2).
Additionally the narrator explains that Gatsby made a nervous circuit around his house right before his and Daisy's encounter.

This shows that Gatsby is nervous on the one hand, but unsure on the other hand, as he probably used that time to think about what was going to happen and what he was going to say or about if it was right to meet (p. 86, l. 14).

In addition as Gatsby returned into the living room after putting himself together a mysterious, but beautiful situation is created by Gatsby and Daisy staring at each other in a way like they would rave from each other.

Gatsby's face is descripeddescribed as glowing and the narrator detects a change in Gatsby, which is the change from his normally mysterious, shy and antisocial traits to this moment where he shows his emotions and rave he has for Daisy (p. 87, l. 9f.).

Furthermore as Nick reenters the scene, Gatsby greets him like they haven't seen each other for years, which symbolizes that he is primaly confused due to his overwhelment but indicates that this short time with Daisy felt like years for him, as it was such a special encounter for him (p. 87, l. 16).

In addition the fact that it was raining outside the house throughout the whole scene until that moment is a contradiction which shows how this previous weird and embarassingembarrassing situation is now overshadowed by positivity and happiness (p. 87, l. 18).

After Gatsby then realises that the sun was shining into the house, which is a symbol for hope and positivity, he asks Daisy what she thinks about it to know what she thinks of their reunion (p. 87, l. 22).

At the end of the scene Gatsby then invites Daisy and Nick over to his mansion to keep this positive flow with Daisy going, as he is now trying to impress and influence her with his wealth (p. 87, l. 25).

To summarize Gatsby's behaviour and character in comparasioncomparison to him in the scenes before one can see that Gatsby has this vulnerable side in his character when it comes to love, friendship and in generallgeneral social contact.

This is because Gatsby puts a lot of value in his status and it is important for him that people like him and so he tries to impress the people around him with his earnings like his medals from the war or just his wealth.

Furthermore in the previous scenes, Gatsby was always seen a mysterious, closed up and cold-blooded, but this scene from Gatsby's and Daisy's reunion gives the exact contrast to what one normally thought of Gatsby as he opens up, shows emotions and creates a positive surrounding.

In addition the narrative way of describing Gatsby's thoughts and behaviour gives the reader a closer understanding how Gatsby actually thinks and is a good method to underline the contrast of what the surrounding think of Gatsby and how he is and what kind of contradictive character he actually is.
